discussion.content:
Question states:
For the sales department, Litware plans to create a team that dynamically updates its membership when users leave and join the department.

These settings are in Azure AD, Membership type: Dynamic User

" Create a team and modify the membership rule for the teams Office 365 group."

Keywords are "membership rule"

In Azure AD, navigate to Groups, new group, Dynamic membership rules, Add Dynamic Query 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/enterprise-users/groups-dynamic-membership

The ans. is A
A is correct but the answer should memership typ and not memership rule. All other answers are wrong for me.

Selected Answer: A
Dynamic membership for team

comments.content: Because it needs to be a dynamic team, that automatically changes with new and going employees.

I was also wondering about this one, until I read the line above the Department Upgrade Requirements - "For the sales department, Litware plans to create a team that dynamically updates its membership when users leave and join the department."

i.e. changing the Membership Type in AAD.
